thinking.disposable_income: Hegewisch has a median income of $58,647, with 45.6% households earning less than $50,000. The community has moderate disposable income, making residents sensitive to cost increases
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution and household sizes, many families have limited discretionary spending capacity. Higher taxes or transportation costs would significantly impact their consumption ability
thinking.accessibility: The area heavily relies on cars (65.2% drive alone) with limited transit usage (10.8%). Most households (87.4%) have at least one vehicle, indicating car-dependent mobility patterns
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower sales tax (0.5%) to protect discretionary spending. 2. Moderate transit fares ($1.25) to maintain service quality while keeping transit affordable. 3. Include some driving fees to improve transit service without excessive burden. 4. Balance between travel time improvements and cost increases. 5. Consider high car dependency while maintaining transit accessibility for the 12.6% no-vehicle households
